answers.answer: Hi, treatment of SFSN depends on the underlying etiology. If it is due to diabetes or pre-diabetic state, then optimal diabetic control and exercise and weight loss to reduce insulin resistance are needed. According to studies done, Anodyne MIRE therapy was no more effective than sham therapy in the treatment of sensory neuropathy in individuals with diabetes. So, its not very effective. Regards.

question: I am not a diabetic. I was told I have nerve damage . A shooting pain from my wrist to my elbow that feels like torture . All I do is scream and cry it is so painful. No numbness .Creams, hot to cold compresses, pain pills to electro pad stimulation, nothing helps. I am 68yrs old,  I have a pacemaker/defibrillator , and recently had open chest surgery. Occurs 2-3 times a day. Most severe in the mornings. Is there any help for me? This has been happening for ten years and getting more painful. Will Anodyne Therapy help?
title: Small Fiber Neuropathy?
